record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Print command panel" and format.name="print" and syslanguage="en"
record.format.name: print

brief.brief: The Print command panel enables you to print a database record to a spool table.

detail.detail: Record: (file variable) Specify the record variable to print.
Format: (character) Specify the name of the form to use to print the record.
Spool File: (file variable) Specify the spool record variable in which to put the record.
Skip to line: (number) Specify the line number on which to begin printing format. The default is the current line.
Exit at top of page: (label) Specify the label of the panel to exit to upon reaching the top of a page.
Run a print.start panel before printing.
When you run a print command that skips to the next page, the print routine automatically adds the old page to the spool table.
The panel keeps its own page counter (the field name is page) and line counter (the field name is eop) in the spool file variable.
Run a print.end panel after all printing completes.
